intro: Ginoria rohrii, commonly known as the silverleaf ginoria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. Ginoria rohrii is relatively low-maintenance and suitable for rock gardens or containers.
